member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.RetrievalModes
member.summary: mode of the contour retrieval algorithm

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.RetrievalModes.External
member.summary: retrieves only the extreme outer contours. It sets `hierarchy[i][2]=hierarchy[i][3]=-1` for all the contours.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.RetrievalModes.List
member.summary: retrieves all of the contours without establishing any hierarchical relationships.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.RetrievalModes.CComp
member.summary: retrieves all of the contours and organizes them into a two-level hierarchy. At the top level, there are external boundaries of the components. At the second level, there are boundaries of the holes. If there is another contour inside a hole of a connected component, it is still put at the top level.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.RetrievalModes.Tree
member.summary: retrieves all of the contours and reconstructs a full hierarchy of nested contours.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ShapeMatchModes
member.summary: Comparison methods for cv::matchShapes

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ShapeMatchModes.I1
member.summary: \f[I_1(A,B) = \sum _{i=1...7} \left | \frac{1}{m^A_i} - \frac{1}{m^B_i} \right |\f]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ShapeMatchModes.I2
member.summary: \f[I_2(A,B) = \sum _{i=1...7} \left | m^A_i - m^B_i \right |\f]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ShapeMatchModes.I3
member.summary: \f[I_3(A,B) = \max _{i=1...7} \frac{ \left| m^A_i - m^B_i \right| }{ \left| m^A_i \right| }\f]

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.TemplateMatchModes
member.summary: Specifies the way the template must be compared with image regions

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.TemplateMatchModes.SqDiffNormed
member.summary: \f[R(x,y)= \frac{\sum_{x',y'} (T(x',y')-I(x+x',y+y'))^2}{\sqrt{\sum_{x',y'}T(x',y')^2 \cdot \sum_{x',y'} I(x+x',y+y')^2}}\f]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.TemplateMatchModes.CCorr
member.summary: \f[R(x,y)= \sum _{x',y'} (T(x',y') \cdot I(x+x',y+y'))\f]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.TemplateMatchModes.CCorrNormed
member.summary: \f[R(x,y)= \frac{\sum_{x',y'} (T(x',y') \cdot I(x+x',y+y'))}{\sqrt{\sum_{x',y'}T(x',y')^2 \cdot \sum_{x',y'} I(x+x',y+y')^2}}\f]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.TemplateMatchModes.CCoeff
member.summary: \f[R(x,y)= \sum _{x',y'} (T'(x',y') \cdot I'(x+x',y+y'))\f] where \f[\begin{array}{l} T'(x',y')=T(x',y') - 1/(w \cdot h) \cdot \sum _{x'',y''} T(x'',y'') \\ I'(x+x',y+y')=I(x+x',y+y') - 1/(w \cdot h) \cdot \sum _{x'',y''} I(x+x'',y+y'') \end{array}\f]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.TemplateMatchModes.CCoeffNormed
member.summary: \f[R(x,y)= \frac{ \sum_{x',y'} (T'(x',y') \cdot I'(x+x',y+y')) }{ \sqrt{\sum_{x',y'}T'(x',y')^2 \cdot \sum_{x',y'} I'(x+x',y+y')^2} }\f]

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ThresholdTypes
member.summary: Thresholding type

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ThresholdTypes.Binary
member.summary: \f[\texttt{dst} (x,y) = \fork{\texttt{maxval}}{if \(\texttt{src}(x,y) > \texttt{thresh}\)}{0}{otherwise}\f]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ThresholdTypes.BinaryInv
member.summary: \f[\texttt{dst} (x,y) = \fork{0}{if \(\texttt{src}(x,y) > \texttt{thresh}\)}{\texttt{maxval}}{otherwise}\f]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ThresholdTypes.Trunc
member.summary: \f[\texttt{dst} (x,y) = \fork{\texttt{threshold}}{if \(\texttt{src}(x,y) > \texttt{thresh}\)}{\texttt{src}(x,y)}{otherwise}\f]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ThresholdTypes.Tozero
member.summary: \f[\texttt{dst} (x,y) = \fork{\texttt{src}(x,y)}{if \(\texttt{src}(x,y) > \texttt{thresh}\)}{0}{otherwise}\f]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ThresholdTypes.TozeroInv
member.summary: \f[\texttt{dst} (x,y) = \fork{0}{if \(\texttt{src}(x,y) > \texttt{thresh}\)}{\texttt{src}(x,y)}{otherwise}\f]

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.LineSegmentDetector.Create(OpenCvSharp.LineSegmentDetectorModes,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a smart pointer to a LineSegmentDetector object and initializes it.
member.param: The way found lines will be refined, see cv::LineSegmentDetectorModes
The scale of the image that will be used to find the lines. Range (0..1].
Sigma for Gaussian filter. It is computed as sigma = _sigma_scale/_scale.
Bound to the quantization error on the gradient norm.
Gradient angle tolerance in degrees.
Detection threshold: -log10(NFA) \> log_eps. Used only when advancent refinement is chosen.
Minimal density of aligned region points in the enclosing rectangle.
Number of bins in pseudo-ordering of gradient modulus.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.LineSegmentDetector.DisposeManaged
member.summary: Releases managed resources

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.LineSegmentDetector.Detect(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray)
member.summary: Finds lines in the input image. This is the output of the default parameters of the algorithm on the above shown image.
member.param: A grayscale (CV_8UC1) input image.

A vector of Vec4i or Vec4f elements specifying the beginning and ending point of a line. Where Vec4i/Vec4f is (x1, y1, x2, y2), point 1 is the start, point 2 - end. Returned lines are strictly oriented depending on the gradient.
Vector of widths of the regions, where the lines are found. E.g. Width of line.
Vector of precisions with which the lines are found.
Vector containing number of false alarms in the line region, with precision of 10%. The bigger the value, logarithmically better the detection.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.LineSegmentDetector.Detect(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.Vec4f[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Finds lines in the input image. This is the output of the default parameters of the algorithm on the above shown image.
member.param: A grayscale (CV_8UC1) input image.

A vector of Vec4i or Vec4f elements specifying the beginning and ending point of a line. Where Vec4i/Vec4f is (x1, y1, x2, y2), point 1 is the start, point 2 - end. Returned lines are strictly oriented depending on the gradient.
Vector of widths of the regions, where the lines are found. E.g. Width of line.
Vector of precisions with which the lines are found.
Vector containing number of false alarms in the line region, with precision of 10%. The bigger the value, logarithmically better the detection.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.LineSegmentDetector.DrawSegments(OpenCvSharp.InputOutputArray,OpenCvSharp.InputArray)
member.summary: Draws the line segments on a given image.
member.param: The image, where the liens will be drawn. Should be bigger or equal to the image, where the lines were found.
A vector of the lines that needed to be drawn.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.LineSegmentDetector.CompareSegments(OpenCvSharp.Size,OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.InputOutputArray)
member.summary: Draws two groups of lines in blue and red, counting the non overlapping (mismatching) pixels.
member.param: The size of the image, where lines1 and lines2 were found.
The first group of lines that needs to be drawn. It is visualized in blue color.
The second group of lines. They visualized in red color.
Optional image, where the lines will be drawn. The image should be color(3-channel) in order for lines1 and lines2 to be drawn in the above mentioned colors.

member.summary: Creates instance by raw pointer cv::ml::ANN_MLP*

member.summary: Creates the empty model.

member.summary: Loads and creates a serialized ANN from a file. Use ANN::save to serialize and store an ANN to disk. Load the ANN from this file again, by calling this function with the path to the file.

member.summary: Loads algorithm from a String.
member.param: he string variable containing the model you want to load.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.DisposeManaged
member.summary: Releases managed resources

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.TermCriteria
member.summary: Termination criteria of the training algorithm.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.BackpropWeightScale
member.summary: Strength of the weight gradient term. The recommended value is about 0.1. Default value is 0.1.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.BackpropMomentumScale
member.summary: Strength of the momentum term (the difference between weights on the 2 previous iterations). This parameter provides some inertia to smooth the random fluctuations of the weights. It can vary from 0 (the feature is disabled) to 1 and beyond. The value 0.1 or so is good enough. Default value is 0.1.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.RpropDW0
member.summary: Initial value Delta_0 of update-values Delta_{ij}. Default value is 0.1.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.RpropDWPlus
member.summary: Increase factor eta^+. It must be >1. Default value is 1.2.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.RpropDWMinus
member.summary: Decrease factor eta^-. It must be \>1. Default value is 0.5.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.RpropDWMin
member.summary: Update-values lower limit Delta_{min}. It must be positive. Default value is FLT_EPSILON.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.RpropDWMax
member.summary: Update-values upper limit Delta_{max}. It must be >1. Default value is 50.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.SetLayerSizes(OpenCvSharp.InputArray)
member.summary: Integer vector specifying the number of neurons in each layer including the input and output layers. The very first element specifies the number of elements in the input layer. The last element - number of elements in the output layer.Default value is empty Mat.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.GetLayerSizes
member.summary: Integer vector specifying the number of neurons in each layer including the input and output layers. The very first element specifies the number of elements in the input layer. The last element - number of elements in the output layer.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.ActivationFunctions
member.summary: possible activation functions

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.ActivationFunctions.Identity
member.summary: Identity function: $f(x)=x

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.ActivationFunctions.SigmoidSym
member.summary: Symmetrical sigmoid: f(x)=\beta*(1-e^{-\alpha x})/(1+e^{-\alpha x}

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.ActivationFunctions.Gaussian
member.summary: Gaussian function: f(x)=\beta e^{-\alpha x*x}

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.TrainFlags
member.summary: Train options

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.TrainFlags.UpdateWeights
member.summary: Update the network weights, rather than compute them from scratch. In the latter case the weights are initialized using the Nguyen-Widrow algorithm.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.TrainFlags.NoInputScale
member.summary: Do not normalize the input vectors. If this flag is not set, the training algorithm normalizes each input feature independently, shifting its mean value to 0 and making the standard deviation equal to 1. If the network is assumed to be updated frequently, the new training data could be much different from original one. In this case, you should take care of proper normalization.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.TrainFlags.NoOutputScale
member.summary: Do not normalize the output vectors. If the flag is not set, the training algorithm normalizes each output feature independently, by transforming it to the certain range depending on the used activation function.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.TrainingMethods
member.summary: Available training methods

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.TrainingMethods.BackProp
member.summary: The back-propagation algorithm.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ANN_MLP.TrainingMethods.RProp
member.summary: The RPROP algorithm. See @cite RPROP93 for details.

member.summary: The number of weak classifiers. Default value is 100.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.Boost.WeightTrimRate
member.summary: A threshold between 0 and 1 used to save computational time. Samples with summary weight \f$\leq 1 - weight_trim_rate do not participate in the *next* iteration of training. Set this parameter to 0 to turn off this functionality. Default value is 0.95.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.Boost.Types
member.summary: Boosting type. Gentle AdaBoost and Real AdaBoost are often the preferable choices.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.Boost.Types.Discrete
member.summary: Discrete AdaBoost.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.Boost.Types.Real
member.summary: Real AdaBoost. It is a technique that utilizes confidence-rated predictions and works well with categorical data.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.Boost.Types.Logit
member.summary: LogitBoost. It can produce good regression fits.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.Boost.Types.Gentle
member.summary: Gentle AdaBoost. It puts less weight on outlier data points and for that reason is often good with regression data.

member.summary: Creates the empty model.

member.summary: Loads and creates a serialized model from a file.

member.summary: Loads algorithm from a String.
member.param: he string variable containing the model you want to load.

member.summary: Releases managed resources

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.MaxCategories
member.summary: Cluster possible values of a categorical variable into K < =maxCategories clusters to find a suboptimal split.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.MaxDepth
member.summary: The maximum possible depth of the tree.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.MinSampleCount
member.summary: If the number of samples in a node is less than this parameter then the node will not be split. Default value is 10.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.CVFolds
member.summary: If CVFolds \> 1 then algorithms prunes the built decision tree using K-fold cross-validation procedure where K is equal to CVFolds. Default value is 10.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.UseSurrogates
member.summary: If true then surrogate splits will be built. These splits allow to work with missing data and compute variable importance correctly. Default value is false.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Use1SERule
member.summary: If true then a pruning will be harsher. This will make a tree more compact and more resistant to the training data noise but a bit less accurate. Default value is true.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.TruncatePrunedTree
member.summary: If true then pruned branches are physically removed from the tree. Otherwise they are retained and it is possible to get results from the original unpruned (or pruned less aggressively) tree. Default value is true.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.RegressionAccuracy
member.summary: Termination criteria for regression trees. If all absolute differences between an estimated value in a node and values of train samples in this node are less than this parameter then the node will not be split further. Default value is 0.01f.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.Priors
member.summary: The array of a priori class probabilities, sorted by the class label value.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.GetRoots
member.summary: Returns indices of root nodes

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.GetNodes
member.summary: Returns all the nodes. all the node indices are indices in the returned vector

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.GetSplits
member.summary: Returns all the splits. all the split indices are indices in the returned vector

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.DTrees.GetSubsets
member.summary: Returns all the bitsets for categorical splits. Split::subsetOfs is an offset in the returned vector

member.summary: Class index normalized to 0..class_count-1 range and assigned to the node. It is used internally in classification trees and tree ensembles.

member.summary: Finds the neighbors and predicts responses for input vectors.
member.param: Input samples stored by rows. It is a single-precision floating-point matrix of `[number_of_samples] * k` size.

neighborResponses Optional output values for corresponding neighbors. It is a single-precision floating-point matrix of `[number_of_samples] * k` size.
Optional output distances from the input vectors to the corresponding neighbors. It is a single-precision floating-point matrix of `[number_of_samples] * k` size.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.NormalBayesClassifier.PredictProb(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,System.Int32)
member.summary: Predicts the response for sample(s).
member.remarks: The method estimates the most probable classes for input vectors. Input vectors (one or more) are stored as rows of the matrix inputs. In case of multiple input vectors, there should be one output vector outputs. The predicted class for a single input vector is returned by the method. The vector outputProbs contains the output probabilities corresponding to each element of result.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.ParamGrid
member.summary: The structure represents the logarithmic grid range of statmodel parameters.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ParamGrid.MinVal
member.summary: Minimum value of the statmodel parameter. Default value is 0.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ParamGrid.MaxVal
member.summary: Maximum value of the statmodel parameter. Default value is 0.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.ParamGrid.LogStep
member.summary: Logarithmic step for iterating the statmodel parameter.
member.remarks: The grid determines the following iteration sequence of the statmodel parameter values: \f[(minVal, minVal*step, minVal*{step}^2, \dots, minVal*{logStep}^n),\f] where \f$n\f$ is the maximal index satisfying \f[\texttt{minVal} * \texttt{logStep} ^n < \texttt{maxVal}\f] The grid is logarithmic, so logStep must always be greater then 1. Default value is 1.

member.summary: Constructor with parameters

vector of responses associated with the training samples.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.StatModel.CalcError(OpenCvSharp.ML.TrainData,System.Boolean,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray)
member.summary: Computes error on the training or test dataset
member.param: the training data

if true, the error is computed over the test subset of the data, otherwise it's computed over the training subset of the data. Please note that if you loaded a completely different dataset to evaluate already trained classifier, you will probably want not to set the test subset at all with TrainData::setTrainTestSplitRatio and specify test=false, so that the error is computed for the whole new set. Yes, this sounds a bit confusing.
the optional output responses.

member.summary: Loads and creates a serialized svm from a file. Use SVM::save to serialize and store an SVM to disk. Load the SVM from this file again, by calling this function with the path to the file.

member.summary: Loads algorithm from a String.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.DisposeManaged
member.summary: Releases managed resources

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Type
member.summary: Type of a %SVM formulation. Default value is SVM::C_SVC.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Gamma
member.summary: Parameter gamma of a kernel function. For SVM::POLY, SVM::RBF, SVM::SIGMOID or SVM::CHI2. Default value is 1.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Coef0
member.summary: Parameter coef0 of a kernel function. For SVM::POLY or SVM::SIGMOID. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Degree
member.summary: Parameter degree of a kernel function. For SVM::POLY. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.C
member.summary: Parameter C of a %SVM optimization problem. For SVM::C_SVC, SVM::EPS_SVR or SVM::NU_SVR. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Nu
member.summary: Parameter nu of a %SVM optimization problem. For SVM::NU_SVC, SVM::ONE_CLASS or SVM::NU_SVR. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.P
member.summary: Parameter epsilon of a %SVM optimization problem. For SVM::EPS_SVR. Default value is 0.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.ClassWeights
member.summary: Optional weights in the SVM::C_SVC problem, assigned to particular classes.
member.remarks: They are multiplied by _C_ so the parameter _C_ of class _i_ becomes `classWeights(i) * C`. Thus these weights affect the misclassification penalty for different classes. The larger weight, the larger penalty on misclassification of data from the corresponding class. Default value is empty Mat.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.TermCriteria
member.summary: Termination criteria of the iterative SVM training procedure which solves a partial case of constrained quadratic optimization problem.
member.remarks: You can specify tolerance and/or the maximum number of iterations. Default value is `TermCriteria( TermCriteria::MAX_ITER + TermCriteria::EPS, 1000, FLT_EPSILON )`;

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelType
member.summary: Type of a %SVM kernel. See SVM::KernelTypes. Default value is SVM::RBF.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.SetCustomKernel(OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Kernel)
member.summary: Initialize with custom kernel.
Trains an %SVM with optimal parameters.
member.param: the training data that can be constructed using TrainData::create or TrainData::loadFromCSV.
Cross-validation parameter. The training set is divided into kFold subsets. One subset is used to test the model, the others form the train set. So, the %SVM algorithm is executed kFold times.
grid for C
grid for gamma
grid for p
grid for nu
grid for coeff
grid for degree

If true and the problem is 2-class classification then the method creates more balanced cross-validation subsets that is proportions between classes in subsets are close to such proportion in the whole train dataset.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.GetSupportVectors
member.summary: Retrieves all the support vectors

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.GetDecisionFunction(System.Int32,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray)
member.summary: Retrieves the decision function
member.param: i the index of the decision function. If the problem solved is regression, 1-class or 2-class classification, then there will be just one decision function and the index should always be 0. Otherwise, in the case of N-class classification, there will be N(N-1)/2 decision functions.
alpha the optional output vector for weights, corresponding to different support vectors. In the case of linear %SVM all the alpha's will be 1's.

the optional output vector of indices of support vectors within the matrix of support vectors (which can be retrieved by SVM::getSupportVectors). In the case of linear %SVM each decision function consists of a single "compressed" support vector.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.GetDefaultGrid(OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.ParamTypes)
member.summary: Generates a grid for SVM parameters.
member.param: SVM parameters IDs that must be one of the SVM::ParamTypes. The grid is generated for the parameter with this ID.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Types
member.summary: SVM type

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Types.CSvc
member.summary: C-Support Vector Classification. n-class classification (n \f$\geq\f$ 2), allows imperfect separation of classes with penalty multiplier C for outliers.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Types.NuSvc
member.summary: nu-Support Vector Classification. n-class classification with possible imperfect separation. Parameter \f$\nu\f$ (in the range 0..1, the larger the value, the smoother the decision boundary) is used instead of C.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Types.OneClass
member.summary: Distribution Estimation (One-class %SVM). All the training data are from the same class, %SVM builds a boundary that separates the class from the rest of the feature space.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Types.EpsSvr
member.summary: epsilon-Support Vector Regression. The distance between feature vectors from the training set and the fitting hyper-plane must be less than p. For outliers the penalty multiplier C is used.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.Types.NuSvr
member.summary: nu-Support Vector Regression. \f$\nu\f$ is used instead of p. See @cite LibSVM for details.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelTypes
member.summary: SVM kernel type

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelTypes.Custom
member.summary: Returned by SVM::getKernelType in case when custom kernel has been set

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelTypes.Linear
member.summary: Linear kernel. No mapping is done, linear discrimination (or regression) is done in the original feature space. It is the fastest option. \f$K(x_i, x_j) = x_i^T x_j\f$.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelTypes.Poly
member.summary: Polynomial kernel: \f$K(x_i, x_j) = (\gamma x_i^T x_j + coef0)^{degree}, \gamma > 0\f$.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelTypes.Rbf
member.summary: Radial basis function (RBF), a good choice in most cases. \f$K(x_i, x_j) = e^{-\gamma ||x_i - x_j||^2}, \gamma > 0\f$.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelTypes.Sigmoid
member.summary: Sigmoid kernel: \f$K(x_i, x_j) = \tanh(\gamma x_i^T x_j + coef0)\f$.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelTypes.Chi2
member.summary: Exponential Chi2 kernel, similar to the RBF kernel: \f$K(x_i, x_j) = e^{-\gamma \chi^2(x_i,x_j)}, \chi^2(x_i,x_j) = (x_i-x_j)^2/(x_i+x_j), \gamma > 0\f$.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.KernelTypes.Inter
member.summary: Histogram intersection kernel. A fast kernel. \f$K(x_i, x_j) = min(x_i,x_j)\f$.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.ML.SVM.ParamTypes
member.summary: SVM params type

member.summary: Releases managed resources

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.EM.ClustersNumber
member.summary: The number of mixture components in the Gaussian mixture model. Default value of the parameter is EM::DEFAULT_NCLUSTERS=5. Some of EM implementation could determine the optimal number of mixtures within a specified value range, but that is not the case in ML yet.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.EM.CovarianceMatrixType
member.summary: Constraint on covariance matrices which defines type of matrices.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.EM.TermCriteria
member.summary: The termination criteria of the %EM algorithm. The EM algorithm can be terminated by the number of iterations termCrit.maxCount (number of M-steps) or when relative change of likelihood logarithm is less than termCrit.epsilon. Default maximum number of iterations is EM::DEFAULT_MAX_ITERS=100.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.EM.GetWeights
member.summary: Returns weights of the mixtures. Returns vector with the number of elements equal to the number of mixtures.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.EM.GetMeans
member.summary: Returns the cluster centers (means of the Gaussian mixture). Returns matrix with the number of rows equal to the number of mixtures and number of columns equal to the space dimensionality.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.EM.GetCovs
member.summary: Returns covariation matrices. Returns vector of covariation matrices. Number of matrices is the number of gaussian mixtures, each matrix is a square floating-point matrix NxN, where N is the space dimensionality.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.EM.TrainEM(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray)
member.summary: Estimates Gaussian mixture parameters from the sample set

member.summary: Estimates Gaussian mixture parameters from the sample set

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.EM.TrainM(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray)
member.summary: Estimates Gaussian mixture parameters from the sample set

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.EM.Predict2(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray)
member.summary: Predicts the response for sample

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.EM.Types
member.summary: Type of covariation matrices

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.EM.Types.CovMatSpherical
member.summary: A scaled identity matrix \f$\mu_k * I\f$. There is the only parameter \f$\mu_k\f$ to be estimated for each matrix. The option may be used in special cases, when the constraint is relevant, or as a first step in the optimization (for example in case when the data is preprocessed with PCA). The results of such preliminary estimation may be passed again to the optimization procedure, this time with covMatType=EM::COV_MAT_DIAGONAL.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.EM.Types.CovMatDiagonal
member.summary: A diagonal matrix with positive diagonal elements. The number of free parameters is d for each matrix. This is most commonly used option yielding good estimation results.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.EM.Types.CovMatGeneric
member.summary: A symmetric positively defined matrix. The number of free parameters in each matrix is about \f$d^2/2\f$. It is not recommended to use this option, unless there is pretty accurate initial estimation of the parameters and/or a huge number of training samples.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.EM.StartStep
member.summary: The initial step the algorithm starts from

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.EM.StartStep.E
member.summary: The algorithm starts with E-step. At least, the initial values of mean vectors, CvEMParams.Means must be passed. Optionally, the user may also provide initial values for weights (CvEMParams.Weights) and/or covariation matrices (CvEMParams.Covs). [CvEM::START_E_STEP]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.EM.StartStep.M
member.summary: The algorithm starts with M-step. The initial probabilities p_i,k must be provided. [CvEM::START_M_STEP]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.EM.StartStep.Auto
member.summary: No values are required from the user, k-means algorithm is used to estimate initial mixtures parameters. [CvEM::START_AUTO_STEP]

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.CascadeClassifier.DetectMultiScale(OpenCvSharp.Mat,System.Double,System.Int32,OpenCvSharp.HaarDetectionType,System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Size},System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Size})
member.summary: Detects objects of different sizes in the input image. The detected objects are returned as a list of rectangles.
member.param: Matrix of the type CV_8U containing an image where objects are detected.
Parameter specifying how much the image size is reduced at each image scale.
Parameter specifying how many neighbors each candidate rectangle should have to retain it.
Parameter with the same meaning for an old cascade as in the function cvHaarDetectObjects. It is not used for a new cascade.
Minimum possible object size. Objects smaller than that are ignored.
Maximum possible object size. Objects larger than that are ignored.
member.returns: Vector of rectangles where each rectangle contains the detected object.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.CascadeClassifier.DetectMultiScale(OpenCvSharp.Mat,System.Int32[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double,System.Int32,OpenCvSharp.HaarDetectionType,System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Size},System.Nullable{OpenCvSharp.Size},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Detects objects of different sizes in the input image. The detected objects are returned as a list of rectangles.
member.param: Matrix of the type CV_8U containing an image where objects are detected.
Parameter specifying how much the image size is reduced at each image scale.
Parameter specifying how many neighbors each candidate rectangle should have to retain it.
Parameter with the same meaning for an old cascade as in the function cvHaarDetectObjects. It is not used for a new cascade.
Minimum possible object size. Objects smaller than that are ignored.
Maximum possible object size. Objects larger than that are ignored.
member.returns: Vector of rectangles where each rectangle contains the detected object.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.HaarDetectionType
member.summary: Modes of operation for cvHaarDetectObjects

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.HaarDetectionType.DoCannyPruning
member.summary: If it is set, the function uses Canny edge detector to reject some image regions that contain too few or too much edges and thus can not contain the searched object. The particular threshold values are tuned for face detection and in this case the pruning speeds up the processing. [CV_HAAR_DO_CANNY_PRUNING]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.HaarDetectionType.ScaleImage
member.summary: For each scale factor used the function will downscale the image rather than "zoom" the feature coordinates in the classifier cascade. Currently, the option can only be used alone, i.e. the flag can not be set together with the others. [CV_HAAR_SCALE_IMAGE]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.HaarDetectionType.FindBiggestObject
member.summary: If it is set, the function finds the largest object (if any) in the image. That is, the output sequence will contain one (or zero) element(s). [CV_HAAR_FIND_BIGGEST_OBJECT]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.HaarDetectionType.DoRoughSearch
member.summary: It should be used only when FindBiggestObject is set and min_neighbors > 0. If the flag is set, the function does not look for candidates of a smaller size as soon as it has found the object (with enough neighbor candidates) at the current scale. Typically, when min_neighbors is fixed, the mode yields less accurate (a bit larger) object rectangle than the regular single-object mode (flags=FindBiggestObject), but it is much faster, up to an order of magnitude. A greater value of min_neighbors may be specified to improve the accuracy. [CV_HAAR_DO_ROUGH_SEARCH]

member.summary: Performs object detection without a multi-scale window.
member.param: Source image. CV_8UC1 and CV_8UC4 types are supported for now.

Threshold for the distance between features and SVM classifying plane. Usually it is 0 and should be specfied in the detector coefficients (as the last free coefficient). But if the free coefficient is omitted (which is allowed), you can specify it manually here.
Window stride. It must be a multiple of block stride.
Mock parameter to keep the CPU interface compatibility. It must be (0,0).
member.returns: Left-top corner points of detected objects boundaries.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.OptFlow.CvOptFlow.UpdateMotionHistory(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.InputOutputArray,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Updates motion history image using the current silhouette
member.param: Silhouette mask that has non-zero pixels where the motion occurs.
Motion history image that is updated by the function (single-channel, 32-bit floating-point).
Current time in milliseconds or other units.
Maximal duration of the motion track in the same units as timestamp .

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.OptFlow.CvOptFlow.CalcMotionGradient(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the motion gradient orientation image from the motion history image
member.param: Motion history single-channel floating-point image.
Output mask image that has the type CV_8UC1 and the same size as mhi. Its non-zero elements mark pixels where the motion gradient data is correct.
Output motion gradient orientation image that has the same type and the same size as mhi. Each pixel of the image is a motion orientation, from 0 to 360 degrees.
Minimal (or maximal) allowed difference between mhi values within a pixel neighborhood.

Maximal (or minimal) allowed difference between mhi values within a pixel neighborhood. That is, the function finds the minimum ( m(x,y) ) and maximum ( M(x,y) ) mhi values over 3x3 neighborhood of each pixel and marks the motion orientation at (x, y) as valid only if: min(delta1, delta2) <= M(x,y)-m(x,y) <= max(delta1, delta2).

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.OptFlow.CvOptFlow.CalcGlobalOrientation(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.InputArray,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes the global orientation of the selected motion history image part
member.param: Motion gradient orientation image calculated by the function CalcMotionGradient() .
Mask image. It may be a conjunction of a valid gradient mask, also calculated by CalcMotionGradient() , and the mask of a region whose direction needs to be calculated.
Motion history image calculated by UpdateMotionHistory() .
Timestamp passed to UpdateMotionHistory() .
Maximum duration of a motion track in milliseconds, passed to UpdateMotionHistory() .

member.param: Motion history image.
Image where the found mask should be stored, single-channel, 32-bit floating-point.
Vector containing ROIs of motion connected components.
Current time in milliseconds or other units.
Segmentation threshold that is recommended to be equal to the interval between motion history “steps” or greater.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.Text.OCRTesseract
member.summary:
Recognize text using the tesseract-ocr API.
Takes image on input and returns recognized text in the output_text parameter. Optionallyprovides also the Rects for individual text elements found(e.g.words), and the list of those text elements with their confidence values.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Text.OCRTesseract.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Text.OCRTesseract.Create(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the OCRTesseract class. Initializes Tesseract.
member.param: datapath the name of the parent directory of tessdata ended with "/", or null to use the system's default directory.
an ISO 639-3 code or NULL will default to "eng".
specifies the list of characters used for recognition. null defaults to "0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ".
tesseract-ocr offers different OCR Engine Modes (OEM), by deffault tesseract::OEM_DEFAULT is used.See the tesseract-ocr API documentation for other possible values.
tesseract-ocr offers different Page Segmentation Modes (PSM) tesseract::PSM_AUTO (fully automatic layout analysis) is used. See the tesseract-ocr API documentation for other possible values.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Text.OCRTesseract.DisposeManaged
member.summary: Releases managed resources

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.Text.OCRTesseract.Run(OpenCvSharp.Mat,System.String@,OpenCvSharp.Rect[]@,System.String[]@,System.Single[]@,OpenCvSharp.Text.ComponentLevels)
member.summary: Recognize text using the tesseract-ocr API. Takes image on input and returns recognized text in the output_text parameter. Optionally provides also the Rects for individual text elements found(e.g.words), and the list of those text elements with their confidence values.
member.param: Input image CV_8UC1 or CV_8UC3
Output text of the tesseract-ocr.
If provided the method will output a list of Rects for the individual text elements found(e.g.words or text lines).
If provided the method will output a list of text strings for the recognition of individual text elements found(e.g.words or text lines).
If provided the method will output a list of confidence values for the recognition of individual text elements found(e.g.words or text lines).
OCR_LEVEL_WORD (by default), or OCR_LEVEL_TEXT_LINE.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.Tracking.TrackerGOTURN
member.summary: GOTURN (@cite GOTURN) is kind of trackers based on Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN).
member.remarks:
* While taking all advantages of CNN trackers, GOTURN is much faster due to offline training without online fine-tuning nature. * GOTURN tracker addresses the problem of single target tracking: given a bounding box label of an object in the first frame of the video,
* we track that object through the rest of the video.NOTE: Current method of GOTURN does not handle occlusions; however, it is fairly * robust to viewpoint changes, lighting changes, and deformations.
* Inputs of GOTURN are two RGB patches representing Target and Search patches resized to 227x227. * Outputs of GOTURN are predicted bounding box coordinates, relative to Search patch coordinate system, in format X1, Y1, X2, Y2. * Original paper is here: [http://davheld.github.io/GOTURN/GOTURN.pdf] * As long as original authors implementation: [https://github.com/davheld/GOTURN#train-the-tracker] * Implementation of training algorithm is placed in separately here due to 3d-party dependencies: * [https://github.com/Auron-X/GOTURN_Training_Toolkit] * GOTURN architecture goturn.prototxt and trained model goturn.caffemodel are accessible on opencv_extra GitHub repository.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.Tracking.TrackerKCF
member.summary: KCF is a novel tracking framework that utilizes properties of circulant matrix to enhance the processing speed. * This tracking method is an implementation of @cite KCF_ECCV which is extended to KFC with color-names features(@cite KCF_CN). * The original paper of KCF is available at [http://www.robots.ox.ac.uk/~joao/publications/henriques_tpami2015.pdf] * as well as the matlab implementation.For more information about KCF with color-names features, please refer to * [http://www.cvl.isy.liu.se/research/objrec/visualtracking/colvistrack/index.html].

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.Tracking.TrackerMedianFlow
member.summary: Median Flow tracker implementation.
member.remarks: The tracker is suitable for very smooth and predictable movements when object is visible throughout the whole sequence.It's quite and accurate for this type of problems (in particular, it was shown by authors to outperform MIL). During the implementation period the code at [http://www.aonsquared.co.uk/node/5], the courtesy of the author Arthur Amarra, was used for the reference purpose.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.Tracking.TrackerTLD
member.summary:
TLD is a novel tracking framework that explicitly decomposes the long-term tracking task into tracking, learning and detection.
The tracker follows the object from frame to frame.The detector localizes all appearances that have been observed so far and corrects the tracker if necessary.The learning estimates detectorfs errors and updates it to avoid these errors in the future.The implementation is based on @cite TLD .
The Median Flow algorithm (see cv::TrackerMedianFlow) was chosen as a tracking component in this implementation, following authors. Tracker is supposed to be able to handle rapid motions, partial occlusions, object absence etc.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.VideoCapture.Grab
member.summary: Grabs the frame from camera or file. The grabbed frame is stored internally. The purpose of this function is to grab frame fast that is important for syncronization in case of reading from several cameras simultaneously. The grabbed frames are not exposed because they may be stored in compressed format (as defined by camera/driver). To retrieve the grabbed frame, cvRetrieveFrame should be used.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.VideoCapture.Retrieve(OpenCvSharp.Mat,System.Int32)
member.summary: Decodes and returns the grabbed video frame.
member.param: non-zero streamIdx is only valid for multi-head camera live streams

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.VideoCapture.Retrieve(OpenCvSharp.Mat,OpenCvSharp.CameraChannels)
member.summary: Returns the pointer to the image grabbed with cvGrabFrame function. The returned image should not be released or modified by user.
member.param: non-zero streamIdx is only valid for multi-head camera live streams

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.VideoWriter.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Double,OpenCvSharp.Size,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates video writer structure.
member.param: Name of the output video file.

4-character code of codec used to compress the frames. For example, "PIM1" is MPEG-1 codec, "MJPG" is motion-jpeg codec etc. Under Win32 it is possible to pass null in order to choose compression method and additional compression parameters from dialog.
Framerate of the created video stream.
Size of video frames.
If it is true, the encoder will expect and encode color frames, otherwise it will work with grayscale frames (the flag is currently supported on Windows only).

member.summary: Kalman filter. The class implements standard Kalman filter \url{http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kalman_filter}. However, you can modify KalmanFilter::transitionMatrix, KalmanFilter::controlMatrix and KalmanFilter::measurementMatrix to get the extended Kalman filter functionality.

member.summary: the default constructor

member.summary: the full constructor taking the dimensionality of the state, of the measurement and of the control vector

member.summary: Releases unmanaged resources

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.StatePre
member.summary: predicted state (x'(k)): x(k)=A*x(k-1)+B*u(k)

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.StatePost
member.summary: corrected state (x(k)): x(k)=x'(k)+K(k)*(z(k)-H*x'(k))

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.TransitionMatrix
member.summary: state transition matrix (A)

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.ControlMatrix
member.summary: control matrix (B) (not used if there is no control)

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.MeasurementMatrix
member.summary: measurement matrix (H)

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.ProcessNoiseCov
member.summary: process noise covariance matrix (Q)

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.MeasurementNoiseCov
member.summary: measurement noise covariance matrix (R)

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.ErrorCovPre
member.summary: priori error estimate covariance matrix (P'(k)): P'(k)=A*P(k-1)*At + Q)*/

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.Gain
member.summary: Kalman gain matrix (K(k)): K(k)=P'(k)*Ht*inv(H*P'(k)*Ht+R)

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.KalmanFilter.ErrorCovPost
member.summary: posteriori error estimate covariance matrix (P(k)): P(k)=(I-K(k)*H)*P'(k)

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.LATCH
member.summary:
LATCH Descriptor.
latch Class for computing the LATCH descriptor. If you find this code useful, please add a reference to the following paper in your work: Gil Levi and Tal Hassner, "LATCH: Learned Arrangements of Three Patch Codes", arXiv preprint arXiv:1501.03719, 15 Jan. 2015.
Note: a complete example can be found under /samples/cpp/tutorial_code/xfeatures2D/latch_match.cpp

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.LATCH.Create(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: the size of the descriptor - can be 64, 32, 16, 8, 4, 2 or 1
whether or not the descriptor should compansate for orientation changes.
the size of half of the mini-patches size. For example, if we would like to compare triplets of patches of size 7x7x then the half_ssd_size should be (7-1)/2 = 3.

sigma value for GaussianBlur smoothing of the source image. Source image will be used without smoothing in case sigma value is 0. Note: the descriptor can be coupled with any keypoint extractor. The only demand is that if you use set rotationInvariance = True then you will have to use an extractor which estimates the patch orientation (in degrees). Examples for such extractors are ORB and SIFT.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.LATCH.DisposeManaged
member.summary: Releases managed resources

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.LUCID
member.summary:
Class implementing the locally uniform comparison image descriptor, described in @cite LUCID.
An image descriptor that can be computed very fast, while being about as robust as, for example, SURF or BRIEF. @note It requires a color image as input.

member.summary: Constructor
member.param: kernel for descriptor construction, where 1=3x3, 2=5x5, 3=7x7 and so forth
kernel for blurring image prior to descriptor construction, where 1=3x3, 2=5x5, 3=7x7 and so forth

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.SIFT
member.summary: SIFT implementation.

member.summary: Creates instance by raw pointer cv::SIFT*

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.SIFT.Create(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: The SIFT constructor.
member.param: The number of best features to retain. The features are ranked by their scores (measured in SIFT algorithm as the local contrast)
The number of layers in each octave. 3 is the value used in D. Lowe paper. The number of octaves is computed automatically from the image resolution.
The contrast threshold used to filter out weak features in semi-uniform (low-contrast) regions. The larger the threshold, the less features are produced by the detector.

The threshold used to filter out edge-like features. Note that the its meaning is different from the contrastThreshold, i.e. the larger the edgeThreshold, the less features are filtered out (more features are retained).
The sigma of the Gaussian applied to the input image at the octave #0. If your image is captured with a weak camera with soft lenses, you might want to reduce the number.

member.summary: Releases managed resources

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.SURF
member.summary: Class for extracting Speeded Up Robust Features from an image.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.SURF.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates instance by raw pointer cv::SURF*

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.SURF.Create(System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The SURF constructor.
member.param: Only features with keypoint.hessian larger than that are extracted.
The number of a gaussian pyramid octaves that the detector uses. It is set to 4 by default. If you want to get very large features, use the larger value. If you want just small features, decrease it.
The number of images within each octave of a gaussian pyramid. It is set to 2 by default.
false means basic descriptors (64 elements each), true means extended descriptors (128 elements each)
false means that detector computes orientation of each feature. true means that the orientation is not computed (which is much, much faster).

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.SURF.DisposeManaged
member.summary: Releases managed resources

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.SURF.HessianThreshold
member.summary: Threshold for the keypoint detector. Only features, whose hessian is larger than hessianThreshold are retained by the detector. Therefore, the larger the value, the less keypoints you will get. A good default value could be from 300 to 500, depending from the image contrast.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.SURF.NOctaves
member.summary: The number of a gaussian pyramid octaves that the detector uses. It is set to 4 by default. If you want to get very large features, use the larger value. If you want just small features, decrease it.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.SURF.NOctaveLayers
member.summary: The number of images within each octave of a gaussian pyramid. It is set to 2 by default.

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.SURF.Extended
member.summary: false means that the basic descriptors (64 elements each) shall be computed. true means that the extended descriptors (128 elements each) shall be computed

member.name: P:OpenCvSharp.XFeatures2D.SURF.Upright
member.summary: false means that detector computes orientation of each feature. true means that the orientation is not computed (which is much, much faster). For example, if you match images from a stereo pair, or do image stitching, the matched features likely have very similar angles, and you can speed up feature extraction by setting upright=true.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.CvXImgProc.NiblackThreshold(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,System.Double,OpenCvSharp.ThresholdTypes,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies Niblack thresholding to input image.
member.remarks: The function transforms a grayscale image to a binary image according to the formulae: - **THRESH_BINARY** \f[dst(x, y) = \fork{\texttt{maxValue } }{if \(src(x, y) > T(x, y)\)}{0}{otherwise}\f] - ** THRESH_BINARY_INV** \f[dst(x, y) = \fork{0}{if \(src(x, y) > T(x, y)\)}{\texttt{maxValue}}{otherwise}\f] where \f$T(x, y)\f$ is a threshold calculated individually for each pixel. The threshold value \f$T(x, y)\f$ is the mean minus \f$ delta \f$ times standard deviation of \f$\texttt{blockSize} \times\texttt{blockSize}\f$ neighborhood of \f$(x, y)\f$. The function can't process the image in-place.
member.param: Source 8-bit single-channel image.
Destination image of the same size and the same type as src.
Non-zero value assigned to the pixels for which the condition is satisfied, used with the THRESH_BINARY and THRESH_BINARY_INV thresholding types.
Thresholding type, see cv::ThresholdTypes.
Size of a pixel neighborhood that is used to calculate a threshold value for the pixel: 3, 5, 7, and so on.
Constant multiplied with the standard deviation and subtracted from the mean. Normally, it is taken to be a real number between 0 and 1.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.CvXImgProc.Thinning(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.ThinningTypes)
member.summary: Applies a binary blob thinning operation, to achieve a skeletization of the input image. The function transforms a binary blob image into a skeletized form using the technique of Zhang-Suen.
member.param: Source 8-bit single-channel image, containing binary blobs, with blobs having 255 pixel values.
Destination image of the same size and the same type as src. The function can work in-place.
Value that defines which thinning algorithm should be used.

member.summary: Performs anisotropic diffusian on an image. The function applies Perona-Malik anisotropic diffusion to an image.
member.param: Grayscale Source image.
Destination image of the same size and the same number of channels as src.
The amount of time to step forward by on each iteration (normally, it's between 0 and 1).
sensitivity to the edges
The number of iterations

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.CvXImgProc.HoughPoint2Line(OpenCvSharp.Point,OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.AngleRangeOption,OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.HoughDeskewOption,OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.RulesOption)
member.summary: Calculates coordinates of line segment corresponded by point in Hough space.
member.remarks: If rules parameter set to RO_STRICT then returned line cut along the border of source image. If rules parameter set to RO_WEAK then in case of point, which belongs the incorrect part of Hough image, returned line will not intersect source image.

The source (input) image of Hough transform.

Specifies strictness of line segment calculating, see cv::RulesOption

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.CvXImgProc.WeightedMedianFilter(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,System.Int32,System.Double,OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.WMFWeightType,OpenCvSharp.Mat)
member.summary: Applies weighted median filter to an image.
member.remarks: For more details about this implementation, please see @cite zhang2014100+
member.param: Joint 8-bit, 1-channel or 3-channel image.
Source 8-bit or floating-point, 1-channel or 3-channel image.
Destination image.
Radius of filtering kernel, should be a positive integer.
Filter range standard deviation for the joint image.
The type of weight definition, see WMFWeightType

A 0-1 mask that has the same size with I. This mask is used to ignore the effect of some pixels. If the pixel value on mask is 0, the pixel will be ignored when maintaining the joint-histogram.This is useful for applications like optical flow occlusion handling.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.CvXImgProc.CovarianceEstimation(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the estimated covariance matrix of an image using the sliding window forumlation.
member.remarks: The window size parameters control the accuracy of the estimation. The sliding window moves over the entire image from the top-left corner to the bottom right corner.Each location of the window represents a sample. If the window is the size of the image, then this gives the exact covariance matrix. For all other cases, the sizes of the window will impact the number of samples and the number of elements in the estimated covariance matrix.
member.param: The source image. Input image must be of a complex type.
The destination estimated covariance matrix. Output matrix will be size (windowRows*windowCols, windowRows*windowCols).
The number of rows in the window.
The number of cols in the window.

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.AngleRangeOption
member.summary: Specifies the part of Hough space to calculate
member.remarks: The enum specifies the part of Hough space to calculate. Each member specifies primarily direction of lines(horizontal or vertical) and the direction of angle changes. Direction of angle changes is from multiples of 90 to odd multiples of 45. The image considered to be written top-down and left-to-right. Angles are started from vertical line and go clockwise. Separate quarters and halves are written in orientation they should be in full Hough space.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.AngleRangeOption.ARO_0_45
member.summary: Vertical primarily direction and clockwise angle changes

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.AngleRangeOption.ARO_45_90
member.summary: Horizontal primarily direction and counterclockwise angle changes

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.AngleRangeOption.ARO_90_135
member.summary: Horizontal primarily direction and clockwise angle changes

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.AngleRangeOption.ARO_315_0
member.summary: Vertical primarily direction and counterclockwise angle changes

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.AngleRangeOption.ARO_315_45
member.summary: Vertical primarily direction

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.AngleRangeOption.ARO_45_135
member.summary: Horizontal primarily direction

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.AngleRangeOption.ARO_315_135
member.summary: Full set of directions

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.AngleRangeOption.ARO_CTR_HOR
member.summary: 90 +/- atan(0.5), interval approximately from 64.5 to 116.5 degrees. It is used for calculating Fast Hough Transform for images skewed by atan(0.5).

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.AngleRangeOption.ARO_CTR_VER
member.summary: +/- atan(0.5), interval approximately from 333.5(-26.5) to 26.5 degrees It is used for calculating Fast Hough Transform for images skewed by atan(0.5).

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.HoughDeskewOption
member.summary: Specifies to do or not to do skewing of Hough transform image
member.remarks: The enum specifies to do or not to do skewing of Hough transform image so it would be no cycling in Hough transform image through borders of image.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.HoughDeskewOption.RAW
member.summary: Use raw cyclic image

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.HoughDeskewOption.DESKEW
member.summary: Prepare deskewed image

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.HoughOP
member.summary: Specifies binary operations.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.HoughOP.FHT_MIN
member.summary: Binary minimum operation. The constant specifies the binary minimum operation @f$ f @f$ that is defined as follows: @f[ f(x, y) = \min(x, y) @f]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.HoughOP.FHT_MAX
member.summary: Binary maximum operation. The constant specifies the binary maximum operation @f$ f @f$ that is defined as follows: @f[ f(x, y) = \max(x, y) @f]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.HoughOP.FHT_ADD
member.summary: Binary addition operation. The constant specifies the binary addition operation @f$ f @f$ that is defined as follows: @f[ f(x, y) = x + y @f]

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.HoughOP.FHT_AVE
member.summary: Binary average operation. The constant specifies the binary average operation @f$ f @f$ that is defined as follows: @f[ f(x, y) = \frac{x + y}{2} @f]

member.name: T:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.RulesOption
member.summary: Specifies the degree of rules validation.
member.remarks: The enum specifies the degree of rules validation. This can be used, for example, to choose a proper way of input arguments validation.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.RulesOption.STRICT
member.summary: Validate each rule in a proper way.

member.name: F:OpenCvSharp.XImgProc.RulesOption.IGNORE_BORDERS
member.summary: Skip validations of image borders.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.XPhoto.CvXPhoto.Inpaint(OpenCvSharp.Mat,OpenCvSharp.Mat,OpenCvSharp.Mat,OpenCvSharp.XPhoto.InpaintTypes)
member.summary: The function implements different single-image inpainting algorithms.
member.param: source image, it could be of any type and any number of channels from 1 to 4. In case of 3- and 4-channels images the function expect them in CIELab colorspace or similar one, where first color component shows intensity, while second and third shows colors. Nonetheless you can try any colorspaces.
mask (CV_8UC1), where non-zero pixels indicate valid image area, while zero pixels indicate area to be inpainted
destination image
see OpenCvSharp.XPhoto.InpaintTypes

member.summary: Implements an efficient fixed-point approximation for applying channel gains, which is the last step of multiple white balance algorithms.
member.param: Input three-channel image in the BGR color space (either CV_8UC3 or CV_16UC3)
Output image of the same size and type as src.
gain for the B channel
gain for the G channel
gain for the R channel

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.XPhoto.CvXPhoto.DctDenoising(OpenCvSharp.Mat,OpenCvSharp.Mat,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: The function implements simple dct-based denoising
member.remarks: http://www.ipol.im/pub/art/2011/ys-dct/
member.param: source image
destination image
expected noise standard deviation
size of block side where dct is computed

member.summary: Performs image denoising using the Block-Matching and 3D-filtering algorithm (http://www.cs.tut.fi/~foi/GCF-BM3D/BM3D_TIP_2007.pdf) with several computational optimizations.Noise expected to be a gaussian white noise.
member.param: Input 8-bit or 16-bit 1-channel image.
Output image of the first step of BM3D with the same size and type as src.
Output image of the second step of BM3D with the same size and type as src.
Parameter regulating filter strength. Big h value perfectly removes noise but also removes image details, smaller h value preserves details but also preserves some noise.
Size in pixels of the template patch that is used for block-matching. Should be power of 2.
Size in pixels of the window that is used to perform block-matching. Affect performance linearly: greater searchWindowsSize - greater denoising time. Must be larger than templateWindowSize.
Block matching threshold for the first step of BM3D (hard thresholding), i.e.maximum distance for which two blocks are considered similar.Value expressed in euclidean distance.
Block matching threshold for the second step of BM3D (Wiener filtering), i.e.maximum distance for which two blocks are considered similar. Value expressed in euclidean distance.
Maximum size of the 3D group for collaborative filtering.
Sliding step to process every next reference block.
Kaiser window parameter that affects the sidelobe attenuation of the transform of the window.Kaiser window is used in order to reduce border effects.To prevent usage of the window, set beta to zero.
Norm used to calculate distance between blocks. L2 is slower than L1 but yields more accurate results.
Step of BM3D to be executed. Allowed are only BM3D_STEP1 and BM3D_STEPALL. BM3D_STEP2 is not allowed as it requires basic estimate to be present.
Type of the orthogonal transform used in collaborative filtering step. Currently only Haar transform is supported.

member.name: M:OpenCvSharp.XPhoto.CvXPhoto.Bm3dDenoising(OpenCvSharp.InputArray,OpenCvSharp.OutputArray,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single,OpenCvSharp.NormTypes,OpenCvSharp.XPhoto.Bm3dSteps,OpenCvSharp.XPhoto.TransformTypes)
member.summary: Performs image denoising using the Block-Matching and 3D-filtering algorithm (http://www.cs.tut.fi/~foi/GCF-BM3D/BM3D_TIP_2007.pdf) with several computational optimizations.Noise expected to be a gaussian white noise.
member.param: Input 8-bit or 16-bit 1-channel image.
Output image with the same size and type as src.
Parameter regulating filter strength. Big h value perfectly removes noise but also removes image details, smaller h value preserves details but also preserves some noise.
Size in pixels of the template patch that is used for block-matching. Should be power of 2.
Size in pixels of the window that is used to perform block-matching. Affect performance linearly: greater searchWindowsSize - greater denoising time. Must be larger than templateWindowSize.
Block matching threshold for the first step of BM3D (hard thresholding), i.e.maximum distance for which two blocks are considered similar.Value expressed in euclidean distance.
Block matching threshold for the second step of BM3D (Wiener filtering), i.e.maximum distance for which two blocks are considered similar. Value expressed in euclidean distance.
Maximum size of the 3D group for collaborative filtering.
Sliding step to process every next reference block.
Kaiser window parameter that affects the sidelobe attenuation of the transform of the window.Kaiser window is used in order to reduce border effects.To prevent usage of the window, set beta to zero.
Norm used to calculate distance between blocks. L2 is slower than L1 but yields more accurate results.
Step of BM3D to be executed. Allowed are only BM3D_STEP1 and BM3D_STEPALL. BM3D_STEP2 is not allowed as it requires basic estimate to be present.
Type of the orthogonal transform used in collaborative filtering step. Currently only Haar transform is supported.
